articles.author: Science X
articles.title: Study shows willow bark extract has broad-spectrum antiviral effect - Phys.org
articles.description: From a seasonal cold to a stomach bug, nobody likes catching a virus—and epidemics can be devastating. We need safe, sustainable antiviral options to treat the outbreaks of the future. Scientists in Finland have now shown that an extract of willow bark—a plan…

articles.author: Neuroscience News
articles.title: Biomarker in Blood Predicts Multiple Sclerosis Progression 1 to 2 Years in Advance - Neuroscience News
articles.description: Researchers has found that elevated levels of NfL in the blood of multiple sclerosis (MS) patients could signal worsening disability within the next one to two years.
articles.content: Summary: Researchers has found that elevated levels of NfL in the blood of multiple sclerosis (MS) patients could signal worsening disability within the next one to two years. This first-of-its-kind … [+8460 chars]

articles.title: Genetics and epidemiology of mutational barcode-defined clonal hematopoiesis - Nature.com
articles.description: A barcode-based approach applied to UK Biobank and an Icelandic cohort identifies drivers of clonal hematopoiesis (CH) and finds associations between CH and multiple diseases. Genome-wide association analyses identify 25 loci associated with CH susceptibility.
